WRITING.TEXT:
I would love to get a legendary!
And then to see "Your Articuno is not likely to make much headway in battle"

Really? Despite me being much more in love with Gen 1, I always thought the Gen 3 games were about the best.
Guess I'm in the minority if your thoughts are correct.

I do like the re-roll thing :)
Almost every "above 80% IV" Pokmon I have... has a bad (or non-optimal) moveset.
Jolteon with Thundershock/Discharge. Vaporeon with Water Gun/Aqua Tail. Machamp with Bullet Punch/Submission (This dude has been almost unusable in battle even with high CP.) Jynx with Pound/Draining Kiss.
Etc.
Not really, but I imagine YOU do?
That's even worse. Imagine losing your Nidoking's Earthquake to get Toxic.
I would have just said "stairs"
Is it something I should know?
Huh. I didn't know that was a thing.
I've seen this posted a lot but there's no actual evidence for this and I've noticed the vibration with no change in the tracker but I happened to be at a usual spawn point.
Ideally, yes. But that's not how the world works and that's probably not something Niantic can overlook.
Confirmed too. Nearby is now active in South Africa for me. Also confirming that both Nearby and Sightings can show at the same time.

Firstly, there's no guarantee that that will EVER be completely stop.
Secondly, you can't ban snipers. If I'm passing by a gym and I see an open spot, it's actually my right to put a Pokmon in. What Niantic SHOULD do is reserve that spot for a short time.

Not everyone has access to a perfect connection 24/7.
And I'd totally understand if the app was always like that, but when the game came out, I wasn't affected much by crappy connections. Now the connection issues cause a lot more trouble than they did before.

Yeah... but NFC allows CreepyPedophile57 to tell all the kids to get a Farfetch'd from him at 23:57 in the alley behind the Tattoo place. A 7 year old kid isn't going to care about the possible dangers of meeting.

Kid used Quick Attack!
Critical hit!
u/JamesDor used Splash!
But nothing happened.
Same. I might be wrong, but I'm pretty sure I've also noticed the vibration occur with NO change in Sightings/Nearby
Well... no, but couldn't that be the start of your downfall?
That's fine with me. I had no exclusives in Gen 1. It's only fair
As I understand, Professor Willow takes them in, checks if everything is okay. Studies anything unique or different in some way and then releases them anyway.

I also thought I'd never find one but a random Zubat transformed a couple days ago for me :)
Keep at it. You'll get one.

Well, I personally don't like the whole way that battling works and the moveset being so limited is terrible. So I've never thought it made sense. However, with everything as is, I think they did make things much more balanced than before.
Have you completed your Gen 1 'dex already?
Well, I guess that's just opinion and I feel the way I feel because I played the original Gen 1 games first, then Gen 2, etc.
If I was starting after Gen 2 was released, I would feel that I missed a level. Like starting a game on level 2.

I'd be okay with that :)
I missed not having one

there are plenty of people who have already completed as much of the dex as they can. What about those people?
Fair enough, but I play very often, and yet I'm not one of those people because the spawns, stops, etc are not as plentiful in my area.
There are also people who don't even have the game yet, or who only officially got the game like a month ago.

Not really. In the games, it was just a number except for the order of which you went vs the opponent.
In PoGo, this has little to no relevance.
If the game was turn-based, it would make a difference. Of course Raichu would be faster than Rhydon.
But it's not turn-based. It's based on the speed and reaction time of the user.
I initially didn't like certain battle stuff too. But I don't think of it as one of the main RPGs so I understand there's a different play-style.

I play the game mainly to collect and complete my Pokdex.
I am currently at 122 caught and 138 seen.
If they release Gen 2, I will probably never find a Chansey, Porygon, etc. And even then, I just feel better finishing as much as I can before we go to Gen 2.
Also, apart from where the community is with finishing their Pokdexes, why would we receive Gen 2 before Gen 1 is completely released? We could honestly have an event for every remaining Pokmon. One for Articuno, one for Zapdos, one for Moltres, one for Mewtwo and one for Mew.
Why would Niantic not take advantage of that?
Unfortunately, the major difference in your example is the Speed stat, which doesn't really feature in Pokmon Go.

That's true, but I definitely think that they could do more with Gen 1 first.
I edited my first comment to respond to more of what you said.

I've never noticed this difference. I'm quite sure that's not true.
I'd love it to be a thing though. Oddish, Zubat, Clefairy, etc should only (or mostly) spawn at night.
Ditto wasn't exclusive to the event, but that is where it first came up and the hype to find it was epic.

The thanksgiving event was good too but less exciting, mainly as there were no Pokemon that had increased encounter rates.
What about Ditto? :O
Now, in my area I see a lot of Jynx so I am unsure of how rare it is.
I've never seen one in the wild. I got lucky and hatched one from an egg.
I just feel like they have an opportunity here to breath new life into a game which is becoming stale
They've literally just had 2 very successful events and have showed us the promise of many more to come, that's APART from the fact that companies have signed up with them for sponsored events that we have yet to see.
I personally don't want Generation 2 before the end of this year. If they have everything happen at once during this holiday, people will see it as a massive distraction from family time, etc. I know I'll probably not be able to play much during Christmas.
It seems, so far, that it's just a promotional drink :/

I currently live in Johannesburg.
It's a bit debatable as to whether South Africa is moving forwards or backwards right now. Sigh. (In my opinion)
But it's definitely pretty urban in the better areas of Johannesburg.

I know it's already been mentioned but maybe this format will suit your fancy. Just a rough comparison (all from my opinion) for you to get a grasp of Gen 2:
* Pretty decent comparisons
**Chikorita/Bayleef/Meganium** = Bulbasaur/Ivysaur/Venusaur
**Cyndaquil/Quilava/Typhlosion** = Charmander/Charmeleon/Charizard
**Totodile/Croconaw/Feraligatr** = Squirtle/Wartortle/Blastoise
**Sentret/Ferret** = Rattata/Raticate.
**Hoothoot/Noctowl** = Pidgey family.
**Spinarak/Ariados** and **Ledyba/Ledian** = Caterpie and Weedle families.
**Houndour/Houndoom** = Growlithe/Arcanine
**Raikou/Entei/Suicune** = Zapdos/Moltres/Articuno
**Larvitar/Pupitar/Tyranitar** = Dratini/Dragonair/Dragonite.
**Celebi** = Mew
**Ho-Oh** and **Lugia** = Mewtwo (These two are the end-game legendaries)
* Other really vague similarities:
**Smeargle** = Ditto (He can't transform like Ditto, but his signature move "Sketch" permanently copies an opponent's move.)
**Snubble/Granbull** = Meowth/Persian
**Stantler** = Tauros
**Miltank** = Snorlax (Expect this one to be a tank in gyms. An appropriate name, ey?)
* Then you probably noticed lots of related evolutions
Golbat - **Crobat**
**Pichu** - Pikachu
**Cleffa** - Clefairy
**Igglybuff** - Jigglypuff
Onix - **Steelix**
Scyther - **Scizor**
Seadra - **Kingdra** (This one will probably be a popular gym defender too)
Porygon - **Porygon2**
Chansey - **Blissey** (This will DEFINITELY be a top defender)
**Tyrogue** - Hitmonchan OR Hitmonlee OR **Hitmontop** (This will probably be the biggest family change in the game)
**Smoochum** - Jynx
**Elekid** - Electabuzz
**Magby** - Magmar
Gloom - **Bellossom** (This is an alternate to Vileplume in the original games, but will probably be a 50% chance in PoGo)
Poliwhirl - **Politoed** (Same as above and the ones below)
Eevee - **Espeon**
Eevee - **Umbreon**
Slowpoke - **Slowking**
* And finally...
**Unown** - This is a unique sorta-legendary Pokmon with almost NO use in battle but that had a fair amount of attention in Gen 2... because there's 26 variants of it. One for every letter of the alphabet (2 new ones were also added later, but that'll probably come in later in PoGo too). I'm really excited to see what they do with this one.

What?! I haven't yet encountered a Chansey and the only Hitmonchan I ever found gave me an Error when I clicked on it so I couldn't get it. I have a couple Omanyte but not enough to evolve yet.
I have not found a Snorlax or Dratini/Dragonair/Dragonite in my area. But luckily, I happened to find them away from home.
I have one nest in my area... in a golf course which is a pay-to-enter area :(
I don't know what phone you have, but on my Samsung, there's a default app called Game Launcher which allows you to force a drop in resolution or a drop in framerate to save your battery etc.
If it makes you feel better, I've never seen a Kabuto yet.

Growlith/Ekans/Geodude Biome.
I think we have similar biomes then.
I'm up the creek without a paddle for most water/ grass types
I haven't seen a Seel or Shellder in the wild yet, if that makes you feel better. I travel a fair bit and if I have time, I stop on my way home to look around local supermarket parking lots, etc. I find parking lots at shopping centers to be goldmines sometimes.
Also my biome was weird during the Halloween event
Same! Maybe it's that biome. I only found Cubones in my biome for almost that entire event. However, at my old workplace where I usually found Clefairy, Zubat and a few water spawns, I almost exclusively found Ghost-types.
I also only found Ditto after the Thanksgiving event so I don't just have fantastic luck, if that's what you're wondering.
Maybe it's just grass.
How far are you with your Pokdex caught and seen?
I caught one this week. I never found one during the event so it was a pretty cool thing for me.

Jeez. I've had a massive amount of fun playing this game and I love it. I honestly think I could continue playing this for at least a year longer. I live in South Africa and, in my area, I don't get constant spawns or Pokstops but I've made it work. There's even people who are 100x worse off than me but they still love the game. Yes, I'd like it to be a bit more balanced, but that's about it.
the cities and places that only get about 50%-75% of the available Pokemon
No such thing. There's a small chance of anything spawning. But other than that, the point is to explore and visit different areas. If you're not doing that, you're not playing the game correctly. Trust me, it makes a huge difference in what you find. Where I live, I mostly find Rock, Ground, Fire and Fighting types.
Why would I continue playing when I know my area never spawns wild Snorlaxs?
I have only ONCE ever seen a Snorlax and I've played from day one. But I used every trick I knew and had no trouble catching it. It was a great achievement to me and if I found a Snorlax every day after that, it would be almost boring. I'm glad some Pokmon are rare.
How of Earth can people justify being excited for new Pokemon when the current gameplay feels like ass???
You sound like you're angry and frustrated about the game for various reasons. Can I ask where (roughly) you live and in what kind of environment?

Firstly, I never said you could choose. I said you could possibly have a chance of hatching either one.
Nothing in Pokmon Go has really given us choices. It's usually been random. Even the Eevee evolutions.
And secondly, if I could choose, I would definitely pick Elekid, Magby etc because I have the basic evolutions already.

I would prefer that baby Pokmon simply replace their basic evolution eggs.
i.e. Pichu hatches from 2km eggs instead of Pikachu. Elekid, Magby etc hatch from 10km eggs instead of Electabuzz, Magmar, etc.
Or, you get a chance to hatch either the baby or the basic evolution form.

Relevant username :)

WRITING.TEXT: What use is a blaster when none of you can aim?
I just really wish you found fossils in the game instead of finding extinct Pokmon waltzing around.

I actually like this feature but I feel like they made the scroll effort too low (if that makes sense)
When I use Chrome on my phone, you have to sort of forcefully drag down to reload a page and I've never accidentally done that before.
However as you said in the post above, it's pretty easy to accidentally close the menu in PoGo.
I think they need to make it a bit harder to pull down. That's all. Then if you actually mean to do it, it'll work fine.
You mean you'd only know it was a shiny after you successfully catch it?
Do you believe in such things?
To me, my priority was Ditto. I never cared as much about XP and having the best gym battlers.

WRITING.TITLE: How would Shiny spawns work?
WRITING.TEXT:
In the vast majority of PoGo, spawns are the same for everyone and the stats of that Pokmon are apparently the same for anyone of the same level.
Does anyone think Shinies will work this way?
If I find a shiny Lapras, would it be a Shiny for everyone? Perhaps only a shiny for people on my level? Or would it be completely unique to my find?
If it is the latter, that more than likely means that the shiny flag will only be triggered when you click on it and it would look normal on the map. Bleh. That means any Pokmon could potentially be a shiny without you knowing.
What do you guys think?

:) Well, of course. But my goal in the game is to collect first, maintain second and battle last.
So the Stardust etc didn't seem worth it at the time when everyone else was saying "lol i got my 53rd ditto!"
... But you're totally right. I got a lot of Stardust and XP from the event and I take my complaint back now.

Oh, well then I think that should be unknown. If you fought a new Pokmon in the original games, they never told you what move type it was using. Only how effective it was when it did damage.

I know. I said I caught it after the event ended. But I caught over 600 Pokmon during the event, trying to find Ditto and I got nothing. I wasted all my items catching every Pidgey, Rattata, Zubat... and one Magikarp.
Then, after the event ended, I had to spend time avoiding encounters and only swiping stops. I randomly used ONE Pokball to catch a Zubat at home and I found Ditto.

I think they hit a good few bumps when they released PoGo, but I have no doubt that they'll get into some kind of awesome rhythm or something now. They've been releasing lots of updates and events so I think we can expect good things.
Not sure if that's sarcasm, but the original in-game moves usually did tell you what type they were.

Well, as I understand, the forced updates are usually to stop people from manipulating old bugs. Not necessarily because something cool and new is released.

Ditto was awesome, even though I only got it after the event ended and I was just casually catching a Zubat to get my streak for the day. (Wasted all my supplies during the event for nothing.)

I tried playing online.
My friends said it was fun.
I spent 14 hours
upgrading my gun.
I didn't know I had to save
and threw it all away...
Because someone killed me
while I was AFK.
"... and since the accident, I have the ability to turn McDonald's leftover fries into haloumi!"
"Yes, Mrs Jones, it appears that the baby's head is going to be 77cm in diameter."
"Yes, a lot of patients complain that it doesn't fit in their mouth. That's because it is a suppository."
"Yes, this DVD-player will cost you your TV, please. And the shampoo will cost you a head of hair. And this coffee will cost you all your mugs."
"Is the Justice League all here? ... Where's Wander Woman?"

"Stop in your tracks, villain! I, Self-Desctructo, will stop you!"
*Explodes*

*Takes first step*
**CLICK**
"What the... I'm stuck! Someone needs to use their teeth to separate these pieces!"
"Aiight, kids, I'm will.i.am and this is English. Imma be yo teacher and we gon' learn a shit-load of stuff."

"Welcome to history. I'm Kanye West. But you knew that. For our first lesson, we're going to start with how the universe started.
In the beginning, there was nothing. Then, because I'm a genius, I decided to create the universe..."
"Hi, class. Welcome to Chemistry. I'm Michael J. Fox. First, check out this amazing reaction. Now, you have to hold the vial VERY steady or else the entire classroom could go up in fla-"
"Does this look infected to you?"
"Could you please go across to McDonalds and get me a Big Mac?"

"I don't have a coupon or money, but I have this."
*gently pulls out gun*

"Could you hold my baby for a minute?"
*runs*
Amazingly, when my sister was a kid, she misheard and actually thought it was a football terrier.

Thank you :)

Formal breeds often considered in North America to be of the pit bull type include the American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, American Bully, and Staffordshire Bull Terrier.[1] The American Bulldog is also sometimes included.

I didn't know what was going on until I realised.

"Wanna know how I got these scars? That's from yesterday, when I killed my grandfather in a car accident. Anyway, we're about half way there now, I'm gonna get onto the freeway so we can really get there quick!"

Here's what always happens to me.
(I live in South Africa, so we drive on the left side of the road - in case anyone is confused by my example below)
So, usually, there's a fair amount of traffic everywhere. Now, if I'm turning right and someone's also turning right in front of me, I want to get ready to shoot across behind that car so as to avoid the traffic in the oncoming lane.
Now what happens way too often, is that this asshole suddenly makes a U-turn instead of turning right and because I'm expecting him/her to continue driving, I usually get a small shock and have to brake hard to avoid hitting them.
If there's a left indicator, a right indicator and a U-turn indicator, I'd never be in that situation.
Also, someone recently mentioned a bar showing HOW hard the person in front of you is braking as opposed to just light on or off.
I just thought this would be another thing that isn't necessary but would be helpful to those that use / want to understand it.
In fact, I'll put this in the main post.
Okay, cool. So if it's a low IV, it might be ground type, for example, and a high IV might mean Psychic type?
It's [Jon Lovitz](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jon_Lovitz) as a baby!
"Feck off!"
Or letters at all.

Unfortunately, they want it to be a more fast-paced game and a gym with 10 Sand Attack Pidgeys is just going to take 10 hours to beat, depending on your attacking moves.
Unfortunately, they want it to be a more fast-paced game and a gym with 10 Sand Attack Pidgeys is just going to take 10 hours to beat.

Why would Hidden Power be a problem? It's usually a randomly assigned type, right? Then the Pokmon with the move keeps that type for Hidden Power.
If there's any specific calculation to give it that type, I've never been aware of it.
I'm sure that wouldn't be too difficult to implement.

I personally think that it won't really be changed much and therefore Wobbuffet and others like Shedinja (one of my favourite Pokmon because of its special situation) will suck and will never be used in actual battles.
IF they do change things, they will probably reroll moves for all new Pokmon and legacy moves will be a thing again.
I'd imagine they'll introduce status effects and abilities. They'll probably eventually extend this to out-of-battle abilities like Pickup.
I hope that's where they're headed, but to be honest, I don't think anything like that would happen anytime soon.
